issue.title: [CI] Python 2.7 run uses Python 3.6
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4041](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4041). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I'm not sure when that started to happen, but you can see here and below:
https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/jobs/468438196#L2973

... that the Python 2.7 run on Travis-CI actually installs and tests with Python 3.6.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4041?focusedCommentId=16722269) by Francois Saint-Jacques (fsaintjacques):*
Introduce 5 days ago in this [PR](https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/9da458437162574f3e0d82e4a51dc6c1589b9f94#diff-aee66b8f0a6985fc804d52208dce2397R55) .This is due to `python` being present in [conda_env_python.yml](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/ci/conda_env_python.yml#L25).

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4041?focusedCommentId=16722301) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Thanks for spotting that!
